Row.Text: The Floating Gardens is the Aztec unique building. Like the Water Mill it replaces, the Floating Gardens increase the City's [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output, but can also be built if the City is adjacent to a Lake or Oasis. It costs less maintenance than the Water Mill, and provides a [ICON_FOOD] Food bonus to all Lake tiles worked by the City.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]The Floating Gardens is the Aztec unique building. Like the Water Mill it replaces, the Floating Gardens increase the City's [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output, but can also be built if the City is adjacent to a Lake or Oasis. It costs less maintenance than the Water Mill, and provides a [ICON_FOOD] Food bonus to all Lake tiles worked by the City.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]The Floating Gardens is the Aztec unique building. Like the Water Mill it replaces, the Floating Gardens increase the City's [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output, but can also be built if the City is adjacent to a Lake or Oasis. It costs less maintenance than the Water Mill, and provides a [ICON_FOOD] Food bonus to all Lake tiles worked by the City.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The Floating Gardens is the Aztec unique building. Like the Water Mill it replaces, the Floating Gardens increase the City's [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output, but can also be built if the City is adjacent to a Lake or Oasis. It costs less maintenance than the Water Mill, and provides a [ICON_FOOD] Food bonus to all Lake tiles worked by the City.

Requires less [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance than the Water Mill it replaces.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_FOOD] Food. Each worked Lake tile provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built next to a River or Lake.
